solution.text:
Surface Area of the pipe = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2(\pi {r_ o}^2 - \pi {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 2\pi \times \frac{23}2 \times 4 + 2 \pi \times \frac{10}2 \times 4 + 2\pi({\frac{23}2}^2 - {\frac{10}2}^2)\)
= 1089\(cm^2\)
Therefore, cost of painting the pipe \(= 1089 \times 0.2\)
= Rs. 217.8

content.text: A cylindrical pipe has an outer diameter of 23 cm and an inner diameter of 10 cm. Its length is 4 cm. It needs to be painted on its outer and inner surfaces, as well as the rims. The cost of painting the pipe is Rs. 0.2 per \(cm^2\). What is the total cost of painting the pipe?

hint.text: Surface Area of the pipe = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims

solution.text:
Cross section of river area = Area of 1 + Area of 2 \(= ac \times \frac 12 (d-c) (a+b) = 134 \times 35 + \frac 12 \times 50\times(134 + 104)\)
\(= 10640 m^2\)
Rate of flow = 2 km/hr = 2000 m/hr
Volume of water flow = Area of cross section \(\times\) Rate of flow
\(= 10640 \times 2000 = 21280000 m^3/hr\)
= 21280 megalitre/hr
One week = 7 days =\( 24 \times 7\) hours = 168 hours
Therefore, volume of water flowing into the sea in one week \(= 168 \times 21280\)
= 3575040 megalitres

content.text: The Vashishti river flows into the Arabian Sea. The cross-section of the river can be approximated as the shape shown in the diagram below. What volume of water (in megalitres) flows into the sea over the course of a week? Note that 1 megalitre = 1000000 litres

hint.text: Remember that the area of a trapezium is \(\frac 12 \times \)(Sum of parallel sides) \(\times\) height

solution.text:
Given the area \(= \frac 12 \times Width \times\) (Sum of parallel sides)
\(= \frac 12 \times 21 \times (25 +\) River Side Length\()\)
Therefore River Side Length = \(\frac{892.5}{10.5} - 25\)
\(= 60 m\)

Volume of pipe=Difference in volumes between outer and inner cylinder
\(= \pi{r_ o}^2 \times h - \pi{r_ i}^2 \times h\)
\(= \pi (17)^2 \times 37 - \pi(13)^2 \times 37\)
= 13954.29\( cm^3\)
\(Mass = Volume \times Density\)

= 120006.86 g

Volume of one brick \(= 20 cm \times 10 cm \times 5 cm = 1000 cm^3\)
\(1 m^3 = 1000000 cm^3\)
Therefore, number of bricks required \(= 20 \times \frac{1000000}{1000}\)
\(= 20000\)

solution.text:
Given the volume of the pipe = V = 5553.43 \(cm^3\)
The volume of a cylindrical pipe = \(\pi{r_ o}^2h - \pi{r_ i}^2h\)
Let the thickness of the pipe be \(x\)
\(\Rightarrow V = \pi (11)^2 \times 31 - \pi (11-x)^2 \times 31\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac {V}{31\pi}=11^2 - (11-x)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow (11-x)^2 = 121 - \frac{V}{31\pi}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 11 - 8\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 3\)
Therefore, the thickness of the pipe is 3 cm

solution.text:

Since the tiles can be perfectly broken into smaller parts, the number of tiles required is the area of the floor divided by the area of each tile. Also, remember that \(1m^2 = 10000 cm^2\)
Therefore, Number of tiles = 220000

=\(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}\times 2025 cm^2\)

content.text: The water tank in Rekha’s house has a base in the shape of an equilateral triangle with each side measuring 45 cm. It is filled with water till a height of 3 metres. She pours some more water into the tank and the new level is 4.5 metres. What volume of water did she pour into the tank? Use \(\sqrt{3} = 1.73\)

hint.text: Area of an equilateral triangle = \(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4} \times side^2\)

solution.text:
The volume of the tank \(= 30 cm \times 44 cm \times 48 cm \)= 63360
Rate of flow into the tank = 8L/minute = 8000\(cm^3\)/minute
Therefore, time taken to fill tank completely \(= \frac {63360}{8000} \)= 7.92 minutes

content.text: Water is pouring into a cuboidal tank of length 30 cm, breadth 44 cm and height 48 cm at the rate of 8L/minute. How many minutes will it take to fill the tank completely?

hint.text: Volume of a cuboidal container = lbh

solution.text:
Curved surface area (CSA) = \(2\pi rh\)
Total surface area = \(2\pi r (r+h) = 2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 3 \times CSA = 4158\)
Therefore, \(2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 6\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow 2\pi r^2 = 4\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 2h\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2}\)
\(CSA = \frac{4158}3 = 2\pi rh = 2\pi r(\frac {r}{2}) = \pi r^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area of Base = \(\pi r^2 = \frac{4158}3\)
\(\Rightarrow r^2 = \frac {4158\times 7}{3\times 22}\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 21 cm\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2} = 10.5 cm\)
Therefore, volume \(= \pi r^2h = 14553 cm^3\)

content.text: A solid cylinder has total surface area of 4158 square centimetres. Its curved surface area is one-third of its total surface area. Find the volume of the cylinder

solution.text:
Volume of cylinder \(= \pi r^2 \times h = \pi \times 14^2 \times 43 = 26488 cm^3\)
Volume of new cuboid = \(lbh\) = Volume of cylinder
Therefore, \(lbh = 26488 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow 27 \times 24 \times h = 26488 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {26488}{27 \times 24} = 40.88\)
The new cuboid is 40.88 cm tall

\(= 2632 cm^2\)

\(\frac 12 \times a \times b + \frac 12 (b + e)(c + d) + \frac 12 \times e \times f + \frac 12 \times g \times (d+f) + \frac 12 \times (a+c) \times g\)
\(= \frac 12 \times 32 \times 33 + \frac 12 \times 73 \times 49 + \frac 12 \times 40 \times 24 + \frac 12 \times 32 \times 40 + \frac 12 \times 65 \times 32\)
\(=4732.5 cm^2\)

solution.text:
Volume of original tube = \((\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h)\)
\(= 3620.57 cm^3\)
Now, Volume of new tube = Volume of original tube
Let the length of the new tube be x
Therefore,\(V_ {new} = (\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h) = (\pi (\frac {11}{2})^2 \times x) - (\pi (\frac {11}{2} - 5)^2 \times x)\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \frac {V_ {original}}{\pi (\frac {11}2)^2-\pi (\frac {11}2 - m)^2}\)
= 38.4 cm

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 936 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(936 m^2\)
Therefore, \(936 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{936}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{9}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 3 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 3.3^2 = 326.7 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(3.3^2 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 326.7 - 108.9 = 217.8 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 7 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(217.8 \times 7\)
= Rs. 1524.6

content.text: You have set up a rain-water harvesting system at your home. A cylindrical container with a radius of 15 dm collects rain-water from your roof. It rained last Monday and some water was collected, raising the height of water in the container by 13 cm. What volume of rain water was collected?

hint.text: Volume of a cylinder = \(πr^2h\). Also note that 1dm = 10cm

solution.text:
Total Curved Surface Area = \(2\pi rh = 154 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow 2rh = \frac{154}{\pi} = 49 cm^2\)
Once you cut the slice, there are three faces without icing: The curved outer surface and the two rectangular inner surfaces. (Remember that the top and bottom surfaces have icing)
Also, length of Base of Slice = Radius of Cylinder and Height of Slice = Height of Cylinder
Therefore, area of the slice that has no icing
= Curved area of slice + 2 \(\times\) Rectangular surface area of slice
\(= \frac{1}{10}\)(Total Curved Surface Area) + 2 \(\times\) (Base \(\times\) Height of slice)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 154 + 2rh\)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 154 + 49\)
= 64.4 \(cm^2\)

content.text: You are given a cylindrical cake with icing on the top and bottom. There is no icing on the curved surface and the curved surface area is \(154 cm^2\). You then cut a straight slice from the cake (as shown below) such that the volume of the slice is exactly \(\frac {1}{10}\) of the volume of the cake. What surface area of your slice has no icing?

hint.text: Think about your slice as a separate object. What faces do not have icing?
